payments,&#8221; said Ajay Banga, Mastercard CEO. &#8220;Further, our broad range of market-leading services&#8212;from insights and analytics to cybersecurity tools&#8212;means we are able to support our partners&#8217; evolving needs in a rapidly changing world. font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:96px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:130%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:72px;"><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#9642;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:130%;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">An increase in other revenues of </font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw;font-size:11pt;">12%</font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">, or </font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw;font-size:11pt;">14%</font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;on a currency-neutral basis. This includes a </font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw;font-size:11pt;">4</font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;percentage point increase due to acquisitions. The remaining 10% growth was driven primarily by the company&#8217;s Cyber &amp; Intelligence and Data &amp; Services solutions. </font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:96px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:130%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:72px;"><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#9642;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:130%;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">A decrease in rebates and incentives of </font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw;font-size:11pt;">10%</font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">, or </font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw;font-size:11pt;">7%</font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;on a currency-neutral basis, primarily due to decreased volumes offset by new and renewed deals. </font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:24px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:130%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:0px;"><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:130%;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">Total operating expenses decreased </font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw;font-size:11pt;">5%</font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">. Excluding the impact of Second-Quarter Special Items, adjusted operating expenses decreased </font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw;font-size:11pt;">6%</font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">, or </font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw;font-size:11pt;">5%</font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;on a currency-neutral basis, and includes </font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw;font-size:11pt;">4</font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;percentage points of growth from acquisitions. Excluding acquisitions, the </font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw;font-size:11pt;">9%</font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;decline was primarily related to lower advertising and marketing, travel and professional fee spend, some of which the company expects to incur in the third quarter of 2020.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:24px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:130%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:0px;"><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:130%;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">Other income (expense) was unfavorable </font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw;font-size:11pt;">$139 million</font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;versus the year-ago period, primarily due to lower net unrealized gains recorded on equity investments in the current period versus the year-ago period. Excluding this activity, adjusted other income (expense) was unfavorable by </font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw;font-size:11pt;">$72 million</font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;versus the year-ago period, primarily due to higher interest expense related to recent debt issuances.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:24px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:130%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:0px;"><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:130%;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">The effective tax rate for the </font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw;font-size:11pt;">second</font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw;font-size:11pt;">2020</font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;was </font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw;font-size:11pt;">16.0%</font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">, versus </font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw;font-size:11pt;">18.7%</font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;for the comparable period in </font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw;font-size:11pt;">2019</font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">. The adjusted effective tax rate for the </font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw;font-size:11pt;">second</font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw;font-size:11pt;">2020</font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;was </font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw;font-size:11pt;">16.3%</font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">, versus </font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw;font-size:11pt;">18.5%</font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;for the comparable period in </font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw;font-size:11pt;">2019</font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">, primarily due to a more favorable geographic mix of earnings. </font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:24px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:130%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:0px;"><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:130%;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">As of </font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw;font-size:11pt;">June&#160;30, 2020</font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">, the company&#8217;s customers had issued </font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw;font-size:11pt;">2.6 billion</font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;Mastercard and Maestro-branded cards.</font></div></td></tr></table><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:8px;padding-top:16px;text-align:left;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;color:#000000;font-weight:bold;">Return of Capital to Shareholders</font></div><div style="line-height:130%;padding-bottom:8px;padding-top:8px;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">During the </font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">second</font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">2020</font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">, Mastercard paid </font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">$401 million</font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;in dividends. The company resumed its share repurchase program at the end of the second quarter. Quarter-to-date through July 27, the company repurchased approximately 3.3 million shares at a cost of $1.0 billion, which leaves $5.9 billion remaining under the current repurchase program authorization. </font></div><div><br></div><div style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;"><div Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:7pt;">2. Growth rates normalized to eliminate the effects of differing switching and carryover days between periods.  Carryover days are those where transactions and volumes from days where the company does not clear and settle are processed.</font></div><div style="text-align:left;font-size:8pt;"><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:8pt;"><br></font></div></td></tr><tr><td><font>&#160;</font></td></tr></table></div></div><div style="line-height:130%;padding-bottom:2px;padding-top:2px;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:130%;padding-bottom:2px;padding-top:2px;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">The following additional details are provided to aid in understanding Mastercard&#8217;s </font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">Year-to-Date</font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">2020</font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;results, versus the year-ago period:</font></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:24px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:130%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:0px;"><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:130%;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">Net revenue decreased </font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw;font-size:11pt;">8%</font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">, or </font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw;font-size:11pt;">6%</font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;on a currency-neutral basis, reflecting the impacts of COVID-19 and includes a </font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw;font-size:11pt;">1%</font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;benefit from acquisitions.  The decline was driven by the impact of the following factors: </font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:130%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#9702;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:130%;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">A </font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw;font-size:11pt;">1%</font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;decrease in gross dollar volume, on a local currency basis, to </font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw;font-size:11pt;">$2.9 trillion</font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">. </font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:130%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#9702;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:130%;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">A decrease in cross-border volume of </font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw;font-size:11pt;">24%</font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;on a local currency basis.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:130%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#9702;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:130%;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">An increase in rebates and incentives of </font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw;font-size:11pt;">6%</font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">, or </font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw;font-size:11pt;">9%</font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;on a currency-neutral basis, primarily due to new and renewed agreements and partially offset by decreased volumes.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;font-family:Times New Roman; Excluding this activity, adjusted other income (expense) was unfavorable by </font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw;font-size:11pt;">$106 million</font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;versus the year-ago period, primarily due to higher interest expense related to recent debt issuances.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:24px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:130%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:0px;"><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:130%;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">The effective tax rate for the first half of </font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw;font-size:11pt;">2020</font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;was </font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw;font-size:11pt;">15.4%</font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">, versus </font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw;font-size:11pt;">17.2%</font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">&#32;for the comparable period in </font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw;font-size:11pt;">2019</font><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">. style="line-height:130%;padding-bottom:8px;padding-top:8px;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><div style="padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;margin-left:auto;margin-right:auto;width:99.609375%;border-collapse:collapse;text-align:left;"><tr><td colspan="3"></td></tr><tr><td style="width:34%;"></td><td style="width:33%;"></td><td style="width:33%;"></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div><img src="mclogoa03.jpg" alt="mclogoa03.jpg" style="height:21px;width:34px;"></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:middle;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="text-align:right;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">8</font></div></td></tr></table></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div><a name="s4CC40C6F415F5E79BF33AA1DAC5E3074"></a></div><div><br></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:8px;padding-top:12px;text-align:left;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;color:#000000;font-weight:bold;">Non-GAAP Financial Information</font></div><div style="line-height:130%;padding-bottom:8px;padding-top:8px;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">Mastercard discloses the following non-GAAP financial measures: adjusted operating expenses, adjusted operating margin, adjusted other income (expense), adjusted effective income tax rate, adjusted net income and adjusted diluted earnings per share (as well as related applicable growth rates versus the comparable period in the prior year).  These non-GAAP financial measures exclude the impact of gains and losses on the company&#8217;s equity investments which includes mark-to-market fair value adjustments, impairments and gains and losses upon disposition, as well as the related tax impacts.  These non-GAAP financial measures also exclude the impact of special items, where applicable, which represent litigation judgments and settlements and certain one-time items, as well as the related tax impacts.  The company excluded these items because management evaluates the underlying operations and performance of the company separately from these recurring and nonrecurring items.</font></div><div style="line-height:130%;padding-bottom:8px;padding-top:8px;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">In addition, the company presents growth rates adjusted for the impact of currency, which is a non-GAAP financial measure. Currency-neutral growth rates are calculated by remeasuring the prior period&#8217;s results using the current period&#8217;s exchange rates for both the translational and transactional impacts on operating results.  The impact of currency translation represents the effect of translating operating results where the functional currency is different from the company&#8217;s U.S. dollar reporting currency.  The impact of the transactional currency represents the effect of converting revenue and expenses occurring in a currency other than the functional currency.  The company believes the presentation of currency-neutral growth rates provides relevant information to facilitate an understanding of its operating results.</font></div><div style="line-height:130%;padding-bottom:8px;padding-top:8px;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">The company believes that the non-GAAP financial measures presented facilitate an understanding of operating performance and provide a meaningful comparison of its results between periods.  The company&#8217;s management uses non-GAAP financial measures to, among other things, evaluate its ongoing operations in relation to historical results, for internal planning and forecasting purposes and in the calculation of performance-based compensation.  </font></div><div style="line-height:130%;padding-bottom:8px;padding-top:8px;text-align:justify;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">The company includes reconciliations of the requisite non-GAAP financial measures to the most directly comparable GAAP financial measures.  The presentation of non-GAAP financial measures should not be considered in isolation or as a substitute for the company&#8217;s related financial results prepared in accordance with GAAP.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:8px;padding-top:12px;text-align:left;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;"><br></font></div><div><br></div><div style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;"><div style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;height:12px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td><td colspan="2" style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;height:12px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td></tr><tr><td colspan="37" style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:8pt;"><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:8pt;">&#160;APMEA = Asia Pacific / Middle East / Africa  </font></div></td></tr><tr><td colspan="37" style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:8pt;"><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:8pt;">Note that the figures in the preceding tables may not sum due to rounding; growth represents change from the comparable year-ago period. </font></div></td></tr></table></div></div><div><br></div><div style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;"><div style="line-height:130%;padding-bottom:8px;padding-top:8px;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><div style="padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;margin-left:auto;margin-right:auto;width:99.609375%;border-collapse:collapse;text-align:left;"><tr><td colspan="3"></td></tr><tr><td style="width:34%;"></td><td style="width:33%;"></td><td style="width:33%;"></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div><img src="mclogoa03.jpg" alt="mclogoa03.jpg" style="height:21px;width:34px;"></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:middle;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="text-align:right;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">12</font></div></td></tr></table></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div><a name="s91AE77CD088459ED8C7745488FBC99C9"></a></div><div><br></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:8px;padding-top:12px;text-align:left;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:12pt;color:#000000;font-weight:bold;">Footnote</font></div><div style="line-height:130%;padding-bottom:8px;padding-top:8px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">The tables set forth the gross dollar volume (&#8220;GDV&#8221;), purchase volume, cash volume and the number of purchase transactions, cash transactions and cards on a regional and global basis for Mastercard&#8482;-branded cards. Growth rates over prior periods are provided for volume-based data.</font></div><div style="line-height:130%;padding-bottom:8px;padding-top:8px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">Debit transactions on Maestro&#174;&#160;and Cirrus&#174;-branded cards and transactions involving brands other than Mastercard are not included in the preceding tables.</font></div><div style="line-height:130%;padding-bottom:8px;padding-top:8px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">For purposes of the table: GDV represents purchase volume plus cash volume and includes the impact of balance transfers and convenience checks; &#8220;purchase volume&#8221; means the aggregate dollar amount of purchases made with Mastercard-branded cards for the relevant period; and &#8220;cash volume&#8221; means the aggregate dollar amount of cash disbursements obtained with Mastercard-branded cards for the relevant period. The number of cards includes virtual cards, which are Mastercard-branded payment accounts that do not generally have physical cards associated with them.</font></div><div style="line-height:130%;padding-bottom:8px;padding-top:8px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">The Mastercard payment product is comprised of credit, charge, debit and prepaid programs, and data relating to each type of program is included in the tables. The tables include information with respect to transactions involving Mastercard-branded cards that are not switched by Mastercard and transactions for which Mastercard does not earn significant revenues.</font></div><div style="line-height:130%;padding-bottom:8px;padding-top:8px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">Information denominated in U.S. dollars is calculated by applying an established U.S. dollar/local currency exchange rate for each local currency in which Mastercard volumes are reported. These exchange rates are calculated on a quarterly basis using the average exchange rate for each quarter. Mastercard reports period-over-period rates of change in purchase volume and cash volume on the basis of local currency information, in order to eliminate the impact of changes in the value of currencies against the U.S. dollar in calculating such rates of change.</font></div><div style="line-height:130%;padding-bottom:8px;padding-top:8px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">The data set forth in the GDV, purchase volume, purchase transactions, cash volume and cash transactions columns is provided by Mastercard customers and is subject to verification by Mastercard and partial cross-checking against information provided by Mastercard&#8217;s transaction switching systems. The data set forth in the cards columns is provided by Mastercard customers and is subject to certain limited verification by Mastercard. A portion of the data set forth in the cards columns reflects the impact of routine portfolio changes among customers and other practices that may lead to over counting of the underlying data in certain circumstances. All data is subject to revision and amendment by Mastercard or Mastercard&#8217;s customers. </font></div><div style="line-height:130%;padding-bottom:8px;padding-top:8px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;">Performance information for prior periods can be found in the Investor Relations section of the Mastercard website at investor.mastercard.com.</font></div><div><br></div><div style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;"><div style="line-height:130%;padding-bottom:8px;padding-top:8px;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><div style="padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;margin-left:auto;margin-right:auto;width:99.609375%;border-collapse:collapse;text-align:left;"><tr><td colspan="3"></td></tr><tr><td style="width:34%;"></td><td style="width:33%;"></td><td style="width:33%;"></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div><img src="mclogoa03.jpg" alt="mclogoa03.jpg" style="height:21px;width:34px;"></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:middle;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="text-align:right;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:MarkForMC Nrw,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">13</font></div></td></tr></table></div></div></div>	</div></body>
</html>
</TEXT>
</DOCUMENT>

<FILENAME>Show.js
<DESCRIPTION>IDEA: XBRL DOCUMENT
<TEXT>
// Edgar(tm) Renderer was created by staff of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission.  Data and content created by government employees within the scope of their employment are not subject to domestic copyright protection. 17 U.S.C. 105.
var Show={};Show.LastAR=null,Show.showAR=function(a,r,w){if(Show.LastAR)Show.hideAR();var e=a;while(e&&e.nodeName!='TABLE')e=e.nextSibling;if(!e||e.nodeName!='TABLE'){var ref=((window)?w.document:document).getElementById(r);if(ref){e=ref.cloneNode(!0);
e.removeAttribute('id');a.parentNode.appendChild(e)}}
if(e)e.style.display='block';Show.LastAR=e};Show.hideAR=function(){Show.LastAR.style.display='none'};Show.toggleNext=function(a){var e=a;while(e.nodeName!='DIV')e=e.nextSibling;if(!e.style){}else if(!e.style.display){}else{var d,p_;if(e.style.display=='none'){d='block';p='-'}else{d='none';p='+'}
e.style.display=d;if(a.textContent){a.textContent=p+a.textContent.substring(1)}else{a.innerText=p+a.innerText.substring(1)}}}
</TEXT>

<FILENAME>report.css
<DESCRIPTION>IDEA: XBRL DOCUMENT
<TEXT>
/* Updated 2009-11-04 */
/* v2.2.0.24 */

/* DefRef Styles */
..report table.authRefData{
	background-color: #def;
	border: 2px solid #2F4497;
	font-size: 1em;
	position: absolute;
}

..report table.authRefData a {
	display: block;
	font-weight: bold;
}

..report table.authRefData p {
	margin-top: 0px;
}

..report table.authRefData .hide {
	background-color: #2F4497;
	padding: 1px 3px 0px 0px;
	text-align: right;
}

..report table.authRefData .hide a:hover {
	background-color: #2F4497;
}

..report table.authRefData .body {
	height: 150px;
	overflow: auto;
	width: 400px;
}

..report table.authRefData table{
	font-size: 1em;
}

/* Report Styles */
..pl a, .pl a:visited {
	color: black;
	text-decoration: none;
}

/* table */
..report {
	background-color: white;
	border: 2px solid #acf;
	clear: both;
	color: black;
	font: normal 8pt Helvetica, Arial, san-serif;
	margin-bottom: 2em;
}

..report hr {
	border: 1px solid #acf;
}

/* Top labels */
..report th {
	background-color: #acf;
	color: black;
	font-weight: bold;
	text-align: center;
}

..report th.void	{
	background-color: transparent;
	color: #000000;
	font: bold 10pt Helvetica, Arial, san-serif;
	text-align: left;
}

..report .pl {
	text-align: left;
	vertical-align: top;
	white-space: normal;
	width: 200px;
	white-space: normal; /* word-wrap: break-word; */
}

..report td.pl a.a {
	cursor: pointer;
	display: block;
	width: 200px;
	overflow: hidden;
}

..report td.pl div.a {
	width: 200px;
}

..report td.pl a:hover {
	background-color: #ffc;
}

/* Header rows... */
..report tr.rh {
	background-color: #acf;
	color: black;
	font-weight: bold;
}

/* Calendars... */
..report .rc {
	background-color: #f0f0f0;
}

/* Even rows... */
..report .re, .report .reu {
	background-color: #def;
}

..report .reu td {
	border-bottom: 1px solid black;
}

/* Odd rows... */
..report .ro, .report .rou {
	background-color: white;
}

..report .rou td {
	border-bottom: 1px solid black;
}

..report .rou table td, .report .reu table td {
	border-bottom: 0px solid black;
}

/* styles for footnote marker */
..report .fn {
	white-space: nowrap;
}

/* styles for numeric types */
..report .num, .report .nump {
	text-align: right;
	white-space: nowrap;
}

..report .nump {
	padding-left: 2em;
}

..report .nump {
	padding: 0px 0.4em 0px 2em;
}

/* styles for text types */
..report .text {
	text-align: left;
	white-space: normal;
}

..report .text .big {
	margin-bottom: 1em;
	width: 17em;
}

..report .text .more {
	display: none;
}

..report .text .note {
	font-style: italic;
	font-weight: bold;
}

..report .text .small {
	width: 10em;
}

..report sup {
	font-style: italic;
}

..report .outerFootnotes {
	font-size: 1em;
}
</TEXT>
